meanings.definition: Corresponding or similar in form and structure
meanings.sent1: The two puzzles are isomorphic in design.
meanings.sent2: The two buildings have isomorphic facades.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how the clouds look isomorphic to fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts and emotions seemed isomorphic, mirroring each other perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The isomorphic patterns on the wallpaper made the room feel harmonious.

meanings.definition: Having the same shape or structure
meanings.sent1: The two keys are isomorphic in shape.
meanings.sent2: The isomorphic crystals fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphic cookies were all perfectly round.
meanings.sent4: The isomorphic trees lined up like soldiers in formation.
meanings.sent5: The isomorphic puzzle pieces clicked together effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Exhibiting a one-to-one correspondence or similarity
meanings.sent1: The isomorphic relationship between the two variables was clear.
meanings.sent2: The isomorphic maps helped us navigate the city easily.
meanings.sent3: The isomorphic dance moves made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Their isomorphic personalities made them inseparable.
meanings.sent5: The isomorphic patterns on the fabric matched perfectly.
